comments:
Build ID: M20070212-1330

Steps To Reproduce:
On IE, set the following: 
  1) Tools -> Internet Options -> Privacy
  2) Choose Advanced
  3) Override cookies and block both 1st and 3rd party cookies

Load the SWT Browser somewhere. It doesn't seem to matter where, Eclipse 3.2/3.3, a home rolled one. 

Go to www.cnn.com and you get a nice stack overflow:

Java version 1.6.0_01 from Sun Microsystems Inc.
Windows XP v. 5.1 on x86
Free/total memory: 9198392/29069312

java.lang.StackOverflowError
at org.eclipse.swt.internal.ole.win32.COMObject.callback6(COMObject.java:115)
at org.eclipse.swt.internal.win32.OS.DispatchMessageW(Native Method)
at org.eclipse.swt.internal.win32.OS.DispatchMessage(OS.java:2265)
at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.readAndDispatch(Display.java:3291)
at 


Detail: Uncaught thread error: swtbrowser-thread 


More information:
Not sure if this effects other browsers or OSs and seems to be very limited to cnn? for some reason. Any other site I have hit that requests cookies seems to behave just fine.

When this does occur though, a popup is displayed stating: Stack overflow at line: 77 and completely freezes where ever the browser is running

also, this occurs on IE 6.

I haven't been able to reproduce this with a few different OS/IE combinations.  Can you confirm that it happens for you with eclipse/swt 3.3 or newer, and with at least one of the following snippets:

http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/org.eclipse.swt.snippets/src/org/eclipse/swt/snippets/Snippet128.java
http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/org.eclipse.swt.snippets/src/org/eclipse/swt/snippets/Snippet173.java
http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/org.eclipse.swt.snippets/src/org/eclipse/swt/snippets/Snippet270.java

Yes I have been able to reproduce it. I didn't see the stack overflow while running it under Eclipse3.3 but it did freeze the entire UI. All of the code snippets produced the error with the stack overflow message. 

I tried running the snippets with the swt jars from eclipse 3.3 and also from v3.3 here: http://www.eclipse.org/swt/

I'll give the 3.4 build a try and see if it still produces the problem. Just for some more info out there, this is the current setup: 

WinXP Professional Version 2002 Service Pack 2
Pentium D 3.00GHz
IE Version: 6.0.2900.2180

I still have yet to see this happen on any other website besides cnn.com. Our beta went out on Friday that has the browser integrated and we have yet to see any bug reports on this issue. It's looking more likely that its a very isolated problem.

I just tried out the 3.4 build and am still seeing the same problems. Again to reproduce you need to set First Party cookies to Block. I just discovered that third party cookies don't seem to effect the problem.
